subSubSection.paragraph: 2. Radix (Radix) alticola (Izzatullaev, Kruglov & Starobogatov, 1983) Figs 3B, C ; 4B ; Table 1
Tajikistan, a hot spring near the Yashilkul' Lake (approximately 37°47'00"N , 72°51'00"E ).

ZISP ( Vinarski and Kantor 2016 ). The holotype is illustrated by Sitnikova et al. (2014) . We studied both the holotype and the paratypes of
R. alticola
.

According to our data ( Aksenova et al. 2018a ),
R. alticola
is endemic to the High Asia mountains; found in Tajikistan (from several sites, including the type locality) and Nepal. In mountain Tajikistan (Pamir), this species inhabits hot springs and satellite streams with relatively warm water.

The shell shape of
R. alticola
is similar to that of
R. auricularia
, but the former species is of much smaller size; its shell height does not exceed 16 mm (see Table 1 ), whereas the shells of
R. auricularia
may reach 35-40 mm in height. The proportions of the copulatory organ of
R. alticola
are very similar to
R. auricularia
(compare Fig. 3A and 3B ).

caption.paragraph:
Table 1. Morphological characterisation of shells and copulative apparatuses of several species in the genus
Radix
.
